section.title: What is it
section.p: Author:Ken Webb. Created:14/09/06 9:11 PM. Title: TurtleExample1. Comment: This is a template that you can use to start a model of a Xholon application.

section.title: How to use it
section.p: By default, this app draws a "toInspi" shape. To have it draw one of the other available shapes, use the "draw" parameter on the browser's URL line. Add one of the following to the end of the URL:
&draw=circle
&draw=square
&draw=poly
&draw=house
&draw=toPolyspi
&draw=toInspi
&draw=toEquispi
&draw=toBranch
&draw=toLBranch
&draw=toLDragon
&draw=nil
&draw=test

section.title: Things to try
section.p: Add "&draw=nil" to the URL line, and reload the page.
Right-click somewhere in the middle of the grid, and select "Xholon Console".
Click inside the new Xholon Console, type "<Turtle/>", and click "Submit".
Erase what you just typed, type "xpath *", and click "Submit".
Right-click "Mode", and select "Toggle Terminal".
Erase the text inside the console, type "pd", and press the Enter key.
Type "color 35", and press the Enter key.
Type "fd 10" to move the turtle forward by 10, and press the Enter key.
Type "rt 90" to turn the turtle 90 degrees right, and press the Enter key.
Type "fd 10", and press the Enter key.
Type "rt 90", and press the Enter key.
Type "fd 10", and press the Enter key.
Type "rt 90", and press the Enter key.
Type "fd 10", and press the Enter key.
Type "rt 90", and press the Enter key.

section.title: Credits and references
section.p: Most of the examples are from: Abelson, H. and diSessa, A. (1980). Turtle Geometry. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.
